Description

L COMMERCE est composé de 100 collaborateurs repartis en 5 pôles, comme suit :

Pôle Commercial
Pôle Marketing
Pôle Opérations
Pôle Finance
Pôle Technologies

Au sein de l'équipe projet et développement du Pôle Technologies, vous aurez pour mission d'explorer la donnée en provenance de notre plateforme e-commerce et de solutions tierces, afin de produire des tableaux de bord et des analyses à destination de nos équipes internes.

Vous devrez faire preuve d'adaptabilité et travaillerez avec les différentes équipes métiers (Commerces, Webmarketing, Finance…) sur l'ensemble de l'écosystème e-commerce (Commandes, Clients, Logistique, Analytics…).

Vos Missions Seront

Extraire, analyser et exploiter les données digitales du site
Mise en place de Tableau de bord à destination des équipes métiers
Nettoyage et remontées d'erreurs sur la données existante
Analyses ponctuelles approfondies sur des demandes internes
Restitution et présentation des résultats de vos analyses
Recommandation et aides à la prise de décisions
Mise en place de dashboard de monitoring de l'activité E-commerce
Transformation de la données brut en binôme avec nos data engineer

Pour réaliser ces missions, vous avez l'habitude de :

Utiliser un outil BI, idéalement PowerBI
Requêter en SQL (PostgreSQL & MySQL)
Vous aider d'un langage de programmation pour traiter la donnée (Python, R…)

Et Idéalement

Requêter une base de données NoSQL (MongoDB)
Connaissez DAX
Utiliser Google Analytics
Connaissez d'autres langages (Java, PHP…)
Manipuler Jira.

Profil

De formation supérieure, vous avez une première expérience en e-commerce et une très bonne culture digitale.

Vous êtes doté d'un esprit analytique, logique, et pragmatique permettant d'analyser tout type de problématique ainsi que d'une aisance relationnelle pour accompagner les équipes internes.

Vous faites preuve de rigueur et de fiabilité dans vos analyses.

Nous recherchons des personnalités dynamiques, sachant prendre des initiatives et qui souhaitent s’impliquer dans les évolutions de notre secteur et du mouvement. Il est important que nos candidats démontrent un réel engagement, des valeurs communes aux valeurs fortes portées par le mouvement Leclerc depuis sa fondation.

En rejoignant L COMMERCE, vous pourrez valoriser et démontrer votre potentiel, développer vos compétences et acquérir une expérience enrichissante, à travers des passerelles entre les différents marchés et entités du Mouvement !

Envie de challenge ? Vous souhaitez tenter l'aventure dans un univers dynamique, enrichissant, au plus près des entrepreneurs ?

Mieux nous connaitre

Le Mouvement E.LECLERC est un groupement coopératif dont les adhérents sont les propriétaires de magasins, soit 592 entrepreneurs, dont Michel-Edouard Leclerc est le porte-parole. Le Mouvement E.leclerc compte 133 000 collaborateurs, qui travaillent collectivement à la réussite de nos 721 magasins (hypers, supers et express), 690 Drives et 2 541 enseignes spécialisées.

L COMMERCE est l’entité digitale du Mouvement E. LECLERC. L COMMERCE conjugue les talents d’une équipe de 100 collaborateurs répartis au sein des différents Pôles tels que le Marketing Digital, le Commercial, les Opérations, les Technologies et la Finance. Ensemble, ils animent au quotidien notre site marchand www.e.leclerc .

Une start up au cœur du Mouvement !
Industries: Commerce de détail de produits d’épicerie

Job_description:
Description

Leader du drive en France, le groupe E.Leclerc cherche un nouveau data analyst pour intégrer son équipe au sein des locaux de Toulouse !

Vous ferez partie d’une équipe jeune et dynamique, en charge du suivi et de l'analyse de toute l’activité des 800 sites E.Leclerc DRIVE ! Vous serez amené à effectuer des études diverses pour les pôles Marketing et Communication, Offre & Merchandising ou encore Logistique.

Au Sein De La Direction Client Omnicanal, Le Service Drive Se Compose De 5 Pôles Repartis De La Manière Suivante

Pôle Assortiment

Pôle Marketing Client

Pôle Développement et Accompagnement réseau

Pôle Logistique

Pôle Datamining & CRM.

Rattaché au Pôle Datamining & CRM, sous la responsabilité de la Chef de Groupe, vos principales missions sont :

Suivi de l’activité des sites E.Leclerc DRIVE et E.Leclerc Chez Moi
Mise en œuvre et analyse de la satisfaction client
Études d'impact des innovations
Prévisions de chiffre d’affaires
Analyse d'opérations commerciales / promotionnelles
Études statistiques, segmentations, modélisations
Accompagnement des équipes dans leur besoins d’analyses ou d’utilisation des outils.

Profil

Vous avez une formation de data analyst / data scientist (bac+5) et êtes attirés par le e-commerce et le digital ? Vous avez une première expérience dans la data (1 an minimum ) ?

Vous êtes polyvalent, dynamique et rigoureux, avec une bonne connaissance des langages de programmation statistiques (SAS principalement et à minima des notions en SQL et en Python) ?

Ce poste est fait pour vous !

Nous recherchons des personnalités dynamiques, sachant prendre des initiatives et qui souhaitent s’impliquer dans les évolutions de notre secteur et du mouvement. Il est important que nos candidats démontrent un réel engagement, des valeurs communes aux valeurs fortes portées par le mouvement Leclerc depuis sa fondation.

En rejoignant le Galec, vous pourrez valoriser et démontrer votre potentiel, développer vos compétences et acquérir une expérience enrichissante, à travers des passerelles entre les différents marchés et entités du Mouvement !

Envie de challenge ? Vous souhaitez tenter l'aventure dans un univers dynamique, enrichissant, au plus près des entrepreneurs ?

Mieux nous connaitre

Le Mouvement E.LECLERC est un groupement coopératif dont les adhérents sont les propriétaires de magasins, soit 592 entrepreneurs, dont Michel-Edouard Leclerc est le porte-parole. Le Mouvement E.leclerc compte 133 000 collaborateurs, qui travaillent collectivement à la réussite de nos 721 magasins (hypers, supers et express), 690 Drives et 2 541 enseignes spécialisées.

Le Galec est l'entité au cœur du système, c'est même le réacteur ! Le Galec conjugue les talents d’une équipe de plus de 824 collaborateurs qui travaillent ensemble au service du front de vente omnicanal de l’Enseigne, c’est-à-dire les hyper/supermarchés, les magasins spécialisés, le drive, le site marchand E.Leclerc et E.Leclerc relais.
Industries: Commerce de détail de produits d’épicerie

Job_description:
Le secteur des marketplaces croît deux fois plus rapidement que l'ensemble du eCommerce. La mission de Mirakl est simple : nous aidons plus de 350+ clients à saisir cette opportunité en leur apportant la première solution SaaS de marketplace, une expertise inégalée et un écosystème de vendeurs et de partenaires pour accélérer le lancement et la croissance de leur marketplace.

Notre dernière levée de fonds de 555 millions de dollars en série E valorise Mirakl à plus de 3,5 milliards de dollars et nous place parmi les acteurs les plus dynamiques de l'eCommerce au niveau mondial.

Your impact:

The Business Intelligence team is the owner of customer data and insights at Mirakl, and acts as the main point of contact for anyone who needs insights about our customers, our products and the business as a whole.

We are on a journey to build a first-class department; enabling the entire company to easily discover, explore, and report on internal data in order to make data-driven decisions.

You will help shape the department and business as it grows, becoming a trusted partner and a source of authority for all things on data and analytics. Experience as Anaplan Model builder required.

What you'll do at Mirakl:

Your mission is organised with two pillars:

50% : Providing insights, dashboarding and mastering our BI datalake

Partner with teams across the business to understand their needs, challenge existing ideas and guide decision-making.
Produce relevant insights, actionable recommendations, with confidence and in a concise manner to drive product and customer strategy.
Build, maintain and continuously improve our reports and dashboards used by the business (currently Tableau).
Collaborate and share best practices and methodologies with the rest of the BI team and wider business.


50% : Model builder Anaplan® :

Working closely with the business teams and FP&A controller on the adoption and utilisation of Anaplan, including, but not limited to:
Headcount forecasting
Gross Merchandise Value forecasting
Annual salary review
Ensure the coherence/consistency between these processes/models
Adapt existing models as the business evolves
Support FP&A project team on major new projects (with Anaplan integrators)


Teams you'll closely interact with include:

The Customer Success team, which includes multiple disciplines covering onboarding, ongoing performance reviews and feature adoption.
The Connect team, on their mission to build a leading platform for sellers.
The FP&A team and all departments in the company involved in Anaplan processes.


What Mirakl is looking for in a candidate:

3+ years in a similar or related role (an e-commerce background is an advantage, but not essential).
Experience as Anaplan Model builder required
Proficient with SQL and Excel
Experience with one or more data-visualisation tools (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, QuickSight etc.)
Excellent written and spoken language skills in English and ability to work in a multi-cultural and multi-lingual environment.
Comfortable working with large datasets and are able to write complex and performant queries.
Comfortable working in a fast moving environment, managing several topics in parallel with different stakeholders.
Strong analytical skills to identify patterns and insights, and to propose actionable recommendations.
Have a natural curiosity and investigative mindset.


We welcome collaborators with their diverse perspectives and experiences to power us forward. These often far exceed conventional job requirements and help us create a culture of continuous learning. If you're ready to join a hyper-growth company at the heart of digital transformation for the world's most forward-thinking organizations, we strongly encourage you to apply to any of our roles, even if you think you're not an exact match.

Mirakl est engagée en faveur de la diversité, de l'égalité des chances et de l'inclusion. Nous célébrons nos différences car nous sommes convaincus que les qualités visibles et invisibles de chaque Mirakl Worker sont une source de force et d'innovation. Dans le cadre de cet engagement, nous étudions toutes les candidatures sans distinction de : genre, ethnicité, religion, orientation sexuelle, handicap, âge ou toute autre caractéristique protégée par la loi.

About Role




As a Business Analyst Intern you work daily on data analytics / strategy consulting tasks and projects related to mining and researching data, later on data optimization, cleaning, and finally on the interpretation and data visualization for clients and internal company needs.




Your mission:




Develop dashboards and descriptive analytics solutions for clients
Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trends
Take care of data integration and database management
Support and maintain existing BI solutions and resolve bugs as they arise
Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses and informative, actionable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement
Collaborate with other teams to build valuable content using BI solutions




Your perks:




Access to very extensive educational resources and opportunities
Flexibility (work location, work from home)
Hi-tech and world-class working tools available also for personal use
Life-coaching & mentoring arranged by senior internal and external mentors
Team-buildings that are really different from “standard” companies




Your superpowers:




Currently enrolled in a University degree (Bachelor/Master) or fresh graduate
Serious interest in data research, data science, consulting and finance audit
Your personality captivates with enthusiasm for innovation, curiosity and the courage to question facts and always double-check data
Ability to thrive in fast-paced environment with competing priorities and last-minute changes
Staying on top of all innovation-related news and leveraging your experience to conceptualize innovation strategies and methodologies
Business acumen and client’s focus
Basics and willing to improve skills in: Tableau, Power BI, Qlick




Your mission frame:




Type: Full Time/Part Time internship (40/30h per week)
Compensation: Non-paid / Students' scholarships
Location: Remote
Duration: 3 Months, optional to be extended up to 6 months
Start: ASAP




The exact starting date of the internship can be flexible after successful interviews and agreement.




This is a Remote (work from home) position.




Note: Due to the high number of applications we receive, we will only respond to applications that match our criteria and expectations. Thank you for understanding.

Job_description:
Do you want to build a tastier future through cutting-edge technologies? We are looking for a mission-driven, creative, and committed Data Science Intern to join us 🦆. Come and bring your skills to the table!

GOURMEY is one of Europe's leading cultivated meat companies with global ambitions. Our vision is to create sustainable cultivated meat delights directly from animal cells for a conscious generation. We believe in a world where succulence can share a table with a positive impact and that cutting-edge technology combined with culinary arts can help us get there.

From engineers, scientists to culinary experts, we’re building an international team that shares the same passion for positive change. Currently a team of 50 Gourmates, we have dozens of nationalities at the table! Our differences are our strengths and our common language is food.

At GOURMEY, you will report directly to Remy Kusters - GOURMEY’s Senior data scientist. The internship can start as early as June. The required length of the internship is 6 months.

What will you be responsible for?

As a Data Science intern, you will join our fast-moving team and support the Data and Discovery team on a large range of transverse projects

Writing data automation scripts and workflow automation for all the lab operations.
Support the R&D, scale-up, and manufacturing teams with automating data-intensive tasks and data analytics.
Work with Gourmey’s data management system to provide full traceability of all R&D, scale-up, and manufacturing operations.


Requirements

You are fully proficient in Python and have experience with SQL and JSON.
Currently enrolled in a master's program in data science or engineering.
Experience with scripting for data automation.
Bioinformatics experience is a plus.
You have excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate clearly and in a structured way.
Be a reliable, agile, and quick-thinking member of our team.
You are fluent in English.


Benefits

You will join a fast-growing startup located in the center of Paris, with a global ambition to build the future of food through cutting-edge technologies in an inclusive work environment valuing the importance of work-life balance, we offer:

€900-1,000 remuneration, depending on your previous experiences
An attractive company health insurance and work-life balance monitoring
Since we are all foodies, we also offer a great kitchen, daily meal vouchers, and fresh fruits and nuts delivered weekly.
Furthermore, we support sustainable transportation and offer extra compensation to those who cycle to work.


What is our recruitment process?

Inclusiveness is at the heart of everything we do at GOURMEY. By being transparent about each step of the process, and why we do things the way we do, we believe we can give all candidates a foretaste of GOURMEY’s culture.

During the process, you will meet some of your team members in different parts of the recruitment process which will look like this:

30mn call with Clémence (our Head of People)
A remote case study in English to give you a taste of what we are working on at GOURMEY, during a 1h-call with Rémy
A last interview on-site (when possible) to meet part of the team and visit the labs & office

Giskard defends the vision of a Responsible AI that serves the economic performance of companies while respecting the rights of citizens. To embody this mission, Giskard enables AI professionals (Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers) to collaborate with business teams to evaluate & test the quality of AI models.

We are building the first collaborative & open-source Quality Assurance platform for *all* AI models. We already empower customers with two solutions:

AI Inspect helps explain AI models to identify risks of errors & biases. It makes the AI development process more efficient, saving time & reducing friction between AI & business teams.
AI Test allows building automated tests on AI models to ensure ethics, robustness & efficiency. Thanks to these tests, businesses can prevent the risks of costly AI incidents in production.


We recently raised our first round of 1.5 million euros, led by Elaia, with participation from Bessemer Venture Partners and notable angel investors. To read more about this fundraising and how it will accelerate our growth, you can read our announcement.

As a Data scientist intern, you will:

Design & develop core ML products: Computer Vision & Time Series inspection & testing
Produce data science content: papers, conferences, blog articles, etc.
Conduct our technological watch: testing of tools for quality in ML
Be at the forefront of the Responsible AI new wave of innovation


Requirements

We are looking for end-of-year internships leading to a full-time hire. For now, we are hiring only interns enrolled in French universities.

Skills

You are in a Data Science Master degree or Bachelor degree
Strong skills in the Python data science stack, especially with pandas, scikit-learn, tensorflow, torch, and transformers
You have some skills in software engineering (use of Git, etc.)
Technical and non-technical writing skills in English


About You

Passionate about building robust solutions to real-life problems
Driven by customer needs & outstanding user experience
Willing to build a real product and see it being used by customers
Hungry for learning new skills every day
Conscious about technology's role in our society
Empathetic team player


Recruitment process

You can get an offer with salary & equity in 3 weeks 🚀

Fit interview: 15 minutes
Tech exercise: 10 days to complete
Tech interview: 45 minutes
Reference call: 1 person
Final interview: 45 minutes


Benefits

We value diversity, equity, and inclusivity. Giskard is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran, or disability status.

We are remote-flex. We value productivity and work/life balance. You can come to our office at Station F on a weekly basis if you live around Paris. You can also work remotely and come to the office on a monthly basis.

After internship, full-time employees are granted a significant equity package. We want to include everyone in the adventure and make it a collective win.

Salary: between 1500€ and 1800€ / month

Welcome to Homa, the gaming technology lab that is taking the industry by storm! Our team of over 200 people, hailing from more than 35 different countries, is dedicated to empowering mobile game creators worldwide to bring their creative ideas to the top charts.

Our Homa Lab platform offers a comprehensive suite of cutting-edge tools that allow developers to stay on top of the latest trends, test new features in real-time, and easily distribute and monetize their games. Our success speaks for itself - our apps have been downloaded over 1 billion times!

Since our inception, we have raised $165 million in total from prominent investors, including Headline, Northzone, Eurazeo, Singular, Quadrille Capital, Fabric Ventures, and Bpifrance. We have also received support from renowned business angels, such as the founders of King, Sorare and Spotify founders.

But what really makes Homa special is our team. We are a diverse group of artists, business developers, engineers, entrepreneurs, and former strategy consultants who all share the same passion for taking over the gaming industry. When you become part of Homa, you'll be joining a dedicated team that creates innovative and high-performing games that resonate with players worldwide.

If you're ready to take your career to the next level and make a real impact in the company, then Homa is the perfect place for you. Join us and let's create the future of gaming together!

Role And Missions—What You Will Do 🚀

You will join our Data team composed of 10 people. Working alongside our Analytics & Data Science experts, you will support them in the implement of new projects. More concretely, you will:

Analyze large and complex data sets representing the behavior of millions online and mobile game players to address strategic and operational business questions;
Provide actionable recommendations and conclusions from games and monetization data to shape features, game economies and future product roadmaps;
Partner with internal stakeholders to understand business requirements, work with cross-functional data and operational teams to design and implement efficient and scalable analytics and reporting solutions;
Build automated dashboards and reports to facilitate company-wide awareness and understanding of key business metrics and player’s experience.


Requirements

If you’re creative, ambitious, and up for taking over the industry, we want you on our team.

Your are preparing a Master Degree (Business School, Engineering School or MSc in a quantitative field)
You ideally have a prevous professional experience with a data first company (e-commerce, tech, gaming, etc.)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with Python and SQL
Passion/Experience in gaming
Experience with Tableau or equivalent is an advantage
Fluent in English


Our Culture—Who We Are🪐

At Homa, we value brains over backgrounds and determination over degrees. We believe actual growth results from diversity — nationalities, backgrounds, skill sets, and personal experiences — all working towards a single objective. If you’ve got the smarts, energy, and motivation, no barriers keep you from going far.

We are the people behind the platform - the creative specialists giving creators the data needed to power up their creativity. At Homa, we live by the three central values:

Ambition: we put flags on summits. We set our goals ambitiously high and don’t shy away from the climb. We’re on a mission to take over an industry thick with incumbents who won’t go quietly into the night. To succeed here, you’ll need a highly metaphorical shield and a sword.
Humility: we put our egos aside. We put our hands up. First to volunteer to help, second to high-five. Having an ego is natural, but letting it run the show is unhelpful to everyone. In the words of Mr. Lamar: Sit down. Be humble.
Curiosity: we keep our eyes open. We believe the best way to know anything is to question everything. And to do that, you need open eyes and open minds at all times.


Benefits
Success is its own reward, but here are the perks as well.
You’ll be working with top tier talent from 34+ countries
If you’re interested in working from our newly-renovated Paris HQ with a rooftop garden and WeWork amenities, we’ve got a desk right here…
You’ll have two annual reviews, meaning you’ll have two chances a year to prove you should be earning more.
Don't speak French and don't want to learn it? Pas de problème, we work in English.
See the world via team events + workation (the infamous company-wide Homa trip).
We have a culture of continuous learning, supporting knowledge sharing & experience gaining through our learning platform.
Essential benefits in France and specific locations: health insurance, meal vouchers, public transport subsidy, child-care benefits, and life insurance.

Job_description: Job Description Who We Are Kearney est un cabinet mondial de conseil en stratégie créé en 1926. Depuis près d’un siècle, l’alliance entre hauteur de vue et savoir-faire opérationnel est un marqueur essentiel de notre maison. C’est cette vision du conseil en stratégie made in Kearney qui nous permet d’avoir un vrai impact dans nos missions et d’accompagner nos client(e)s dans la réussite de leurs transformations.Fier(e)s de tenir notre rang parmi les leaders mondiaux du conseil en stratégie, nous comptons aujourd’hui 4 000 Kearney Originals répartis dans 60 bureaux et 40 pays.Le conseil en stratégie est un secteur exigeant et passionnant. Vous évoluez dans un univers de services intellectuels à haute valeur ajoutée où la culture d’excellence, la curiosité, l’engagement, le sens du résultat et du service client sont aussi fondamentaux que l’esprit collaboratif et la bonne humeur. Kearney Analytics La Practice Kearney Analytics intervient auprès d’entreprise de divers secteurs en appliquant des algorithmes d’Advanced Analytics et Data Science pour fournir des insights stratégiques et résoudre des problématiques Business concrètes.Dans Ce Poste, Vous Travaillerez Sur L'ensemble De La Chaîne De Valeur De L’analytiqueNous recherchons un consultant passionné et talentueux en Analytics & Data Science pour rejoindre notre équipe en croissance. Appréhender les problématiques stratégiques des clients et traduire cela en solutions analytiques  Déterminer les meilleures données et approches analytiques pour résoudre le problème  Analyser de grands volumes de données internes et externes  Appliquer des algorithmes d’Advanced Analytics et Data Science (e.g : modélisation prédictive, machine learning…) pour optimiser les opérations stratégiques, le design de produit, le marketing… Exemple De Missions Sur Lesquelles Vous Travaillerez Optimisation de la Supply Chain grâce à des modèles scientifiques, des simulations et des algorithmes prédictifs.  Analyse des avis de consommateurs pour l'amélioration de la conception de produits à travers des algorithmes de Natural Language Processing, Topic Modelling et Sentiment Analysis  QualificationsIdéalement, Vous Correspondez Au Profil Suivant  Vos êtes diplômé.e d’une Ecole d’Ingénieur de premier rang dans un domaine lié à l’informatique, Data Science, Statistiques, Econométrie ou à un domaine similaire  Vous avez une première expérience pratique des Analytics et Data Science acquise lors de précédents stages  Vous êtes passionné.e par l'analyse de la données et son interprétation dans une optique d’amélioration Business.  Vous êtes capable de présenter et de communiquer des concepts analytiques complexes à un public non technique.  Vous maîtrisez au moins un langage de script (par exemple Python, R). En outre, des connaissances dans au moins deux des domaines suivants sont un atout : Bases de données SQL et NoSQL, modélisation des données  Outils de traitement de données (par exemple Alteryx, Knime)  Outils de Data Visualisation (Power BI, Tableau)  Vous parlez couramment le français et l'anglais  Language RequirementsFrançais et Anglais

Job_description:
Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 800 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are community, activism, transparency, dedication and greatness. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Data Analyst Marketing Intern (F/M/D)

6 months internship, starting in September, based in Paris

About The Role

You will be part of the global Performance marketing team and be responsible for reporting and monitoring the activity. As a Data Analyst intern, you will ensure that we have the right tools to steer and report. You'll be in charge of Affiliation data health! Using data analytics, you will support strategic decision making for business growth, working hand in hand with global functions, the regional teams and the data teams. You are entrepreneurial, a self-starter, comfortable both working independently as well as collaborating across teams. You are keen to dive headfirst into a fast-growing, global fashion tech business!

What You'll Do

Build and improve existing dashboard and reporting tools to help channel managers monitor their channel in the best way possible.
Automatize reporting & recurring reports.
Set up alerts to flag changes in reporting, highlighting data issues and changes in trends.
Set up new processes to automate data sends between numerous sources ensuring reporting is up to date and accurate.
Ensure all affiliate data is mapped correctly against each publisher and the wider channel to enable more accurate steering decisions.
Collaborate closely with the Marketing Intelligence team to support fixing open data issues.


Who You Are

Master's degree in Business, Data Science, Statistics, Digital Marketing.
Advanced proficiency in Excel and SQL.
Experience with a data visualization tool is a good plus (Tableau, Google Studio…).
Demonstrate an ability to understand performance and be able to identify opportunities.
Be structured, organized, motivated by a growing fast-paced team.
Enjoy working as a team-player and learning from others.
If you know how to code in python that's also a plus!
Fluent in English (French is not required).


What We Offer

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability
Hybrid working: working from the office 3-4 days per week
The opportunity to do career defining work in a fast growing French-born scale up
The possibility to work as part of a global diverse team with more than 50 nationalities
2 days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association
Significant investment in your learning and growth
Competitive compensation and benefits package
As a full member of our entrepreneurial project, you will be eligible to receive VC's shares.


Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer.

Job_title: Internship - Team Assistant Too Faced EMEA June 2023
Job_description:
About Us




The Estée Lauder Companies Inc. is one of the world’s leading manufacturers and marketers of quality skin care, makeup, fragrance and hair care products. The company’s products are sold in approximately 150 countries and territories under brand names including: Estée Lauder, Aramis, Clinique, Lab Series, Origins, M·A·C, La Mer, Bobbi Brown, Aveda, Jo Malone London, Bumble and bumble, Darphin Paris, TOM FORD BEAUTY, Smashbox, AERIN Beauty, Le Labo, Editions de Parfums Frédéric Malle, GLAMGLOW, KILIAN PARIS, Too Faced, Dr.Jart+, and the DECIEM family of brands, including The Ordinary and NIOD.




At Too Faced, we believe makeup is power, giving women the freedom to express themselves and the confidence to take on the world. Makeup is so much more than a little color on your face. It's a mood booster and a powerful ally. So be a star, shimmer it up and take over the world! We are here to give you the tools to create your own looks, find what you love and own your pretty. Too Faced is looking for a new intern starting may 2023 for 6 months.




About Your Responsibilities




You will be supporting the Too Faced EMEA regional team on sales administration missions.




Your main mission will be to extract and centralize data received by retailers and communicate it to the rest of the Too faced team. You will do so by filling weekly and monthly reports on performances, and collect any comments the commercial team may have to cascade to management.




You will also be responsible for handling all ‘no charge orders’, i.e place orders for any free products to send retailers, stores or team, whether from the warehouse through affiliates or from the office.




You will have additional sales administration responsibilities such a translation review, presentation support, database maintenance, accounting support etc.




See Detailed But Non Exhaustive List Of Tasks Below




Data Analysis:
Weekly and monthly retail sales/sell through analysis
Extraction from retailer’s data
Synthetization
Centralization in internal dashboards
Collection of comments from field team, synthetization and communication to broader team
Orders:
No charge orders
Collection of orders from team
Conversion into internal order form and communication with affiliate
Tracking of order delivery and budget
Office order
Placement of weekly office order
Distribution of products to team members
Shipment of products to retailer’s contacts/outside employees
Database management:
Management of internal product database (maintaining right product status etc)
Price communication to affiliates
Retail sales communication to affiliates and sanitization check of system
Accounting:
Maintain expense tracker
Communicate monthly expenses to affiliates




An internship agreement provided by your school is mandatory.




Qualifications




About you:




Required Language Proficiency: English and French fluent




available for a 4 to 6 months internship




Benefits




Located in Neuilly-sur-Seine




International environment with over 40 nationalities in the office




up to 10 days a month of remote working




10 days of remote working in the EU within your internship framework




Conciergerie (corporate store, gym center, beauty salon)




A gift bag of products at the end of your internship




A meal voucher card




Job: Marketing




Primary Location: FR-IDF-Hauts-de-Seine




Job Type: Internship




Schedule: Full-time




Shift: 1st (Day) Shift

Job_title: Junior Data Analyst (Remote Internship – Data Analysis)
Job_description:
LOCATION: Remote Work




SCHEDULE: Part-time




Are you an aspiring data analyst seeking an unparalleled opportunity to gain hands-on experience while working with a prestigious Management Consulting firm? TalentKompass Deutschland, a leading Human Resources company based in Germany, is searching for a highly motivated Data Analysis Intern to join our esteemed client. This remote position offers a unique chance for someone who is passionate about data analysis and eager to learn in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.




As a Data Analysis Intern, you will work closely with the analytics and consulting teams, where you will be responsible for a range of tasks, including data collection, data cleaning, and statistical analysis. You will have the extraordinary opportunity to learn from experienced professionals who will provide mentorship and guidance throughout the internship. With this internship, you will gain valuable experience in data analysis, data visualization, and teamwork – all essential skills for a successful career in this field.




Responsibilities:




Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to support consulting projects
Assist in the development of data models and statistical analysis to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze data
Create data visualizations and dashboards using tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Present findings and insights to the consulting team and contribute to project reports
Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute ideas for data-driven solutions
Support the team with general administrative tasks as needed


Requirements:




Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficient in Microsoft Excel or other data analysis tools
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Familiarity with data analysis principles and practices
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Knowledge of statistical analysis tools and techniques is a plus
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI is a plus


At TalentKompass Deutschland, we are committed to helping our interns develop their skills and reach their full potential. Our client is a reputable Management Consulting firm that will provide invaluable experience in a competitive industry. Don't miss this fantastic opportunity to grow your career in data analysis – apply now!
Industries: Transport, Logistique, Supply Chain et Stockage

Job_description:
Our Company




As the world leader in alternative animal proteins, Innovafeed contributes to the construction of a sustainable food system by developing a pioneering and innovative industry: the breeding and processing of insects (Hermetia Illucens fly).




Our mission:




Dealing with global protein deficit by strengthening our food systems
To have a positive overall environmental impact based on circular economy and inspired by natural food chains;
To generate territorial economic dynamism : in order to feed and raise our larvaes, we are co-located with agro-industrial partners that provide us with co-products and low footprint energy





Incorporated in 2016, Innovafeed manufactures and sells 3 different insect-based products:




Insect protein for a more sustainable and qualitative aquaculture, especially for feeding salmon and trout 🐟
Insect oil for feeding animals (like pig and poultry), in the context of sustainable farming respectful of animal welfare 🐤
Insect feces used as an effective organic fertilizer 🌱





In September of 2022, at Innovafeed, we raised US$ 250 million in Series D funding bringing the total cumulative financing to US$ 450 million. This capital will be used to further increase our production capacity in France through the further expansion of our Nesle site in the north of France, the world’s largest vertical insect farm.




To meet this challenge in the most eco-friendly way possible, we have set up a system of industrial symbiosis explained in this video: click here




The success of our project depends on a dynamic and talented team sharing the same values and driven by a common objective : to continue our development as a world leader in the animal nutrition market !




In order to support this scale-up, we are looking for new talents able to get deeply involved in our ambitious and dynamic company.




Are you willing to get involved in building a more natural and sustainable food system? Are you interested in biotechnology and sensitive to the problems of food scarcity? So, we think you are ready to be part of the InnovaFeed adventure !




Our recruitment process is objective, inclusive and fair. It’s very important for us to offer from the start a clear, smooth and constructive recruitment experience for each applicant.




Your missions




We are seeking a highly motivated Junior Data Engineer to join our team.




As a Junior data engineer, you will be responsible for supporting the design, development, and maintenance of our data infrastructure. You will ensure data quality and availability. You will work closely with operational teams (performance, production, quality) and data scientists to identify data needs, design data models and implement data pipelines.




More precisely, you will be in charge of :




Develop, maintain and optimize data pipelines
Collaborate with data scientists and process engineers to design and implement data models to better understand our insect meal production processes
Ensure data quality and consistency throughout the data pipeline
Identify and implement improvements to data infrastructure and processes
Monitor and maintain data infrastructure to ensure performance and availability
Keep up-to-date with industry trends and technologies in data engineering





At Innovafeed, we strongly believe that an efficient use of data is a key enabler for the industrialization of our production processes. As a junior data engineer, by leveraging data from out IoT sensors, automation and production systems, you will take a significant part in the acceleration of our industrial scale-up.




As part of our technology stack, you will work with state-of-the-art tools including Snowflake, Matillion, Power BI and Databricks.




Your profile and skills




You have a master degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field and a first experience in data engineering (internships included)
You have experience with SQL and relation databases and are familiar with programming languages such as Python, Java etc.. (throughout student projects or internships)
You are able to work in a team environment and to communicate effectively with technical and non technical stakeholders
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills and are Fluent in French and English





Perks of joining Innovafeed




A customized on-boarding process to discover our business through an operator training and the role of each team through dedicated presentations ;
A particular care in the follow-up of your integration via specific exchanges and a feedback report;
Alan's mutual insurance and provident fund for all;
An important involvement of the employees in the growth and construction of the company (working groups, surveys...);
An internal training program to allow you to develop
Industries: Transport, Logistique, Supply Chain et Stockage

Job_description:
Are you energized by solving tough business problems?




Do you have a passion to transform P&G's brand building while enabling better decision-making with cutting (e.g.




ranging from Data Science to Behavioral Science)?




If so, then a role in the Analytics and Insights organization is for you!




The Analytics & Insights career in P&G takes you across a breadth of experiences, on multiple P&G businesses,




likely in multiple countries, always with an international perspective, always fast-paced.




It is a unique opportunity to develop both the ever-more demanded Data Science skillset and the strategic




thinking needed to manage P&G business.




The most distinguishing traits of whom we hire in A&I are curiosity and mental agility to relentlessly learn more (esp. about business, but equally also psychology, mathematics, and coding): all we need is an eagerness to learn,




the rest we will develop, as we grow our talents from within.




YOUR CONTRIBUTION TO P&G’S SUCCESS:




Earn the role of trusted advisor to the Business Unit Leadership Team




Deliver regular insights, by using advanced analytics techniques, mining extremely large data sets (the hyped Big Data), and applying best-in-class algorithms developed with/by other Data Scientists, examples could be building models to propose possible scenarios and answer the toughest business questions of the leadership team, optimize algorithms in accuracy and performance to then recommend specific actions to your business partners, discover unknown truths by mining new data sets;
Develop closed-loop experimentation capabilities, to test and learn about key business questions;
Lead and improve the analytical program of your business unit, together with the other functions: design the data strategy for the business unit adopt the right platform and big data technologies.




Grow the organization’s knowledge and skills in the space of Data & Analytics:




Take from proof of concept to scaled capabilities the best innovative algorithms from your colleagues and operationalize best-in-class Data-science practice (e.g. cross validation and target shuffling) to all key models and algorithms;
Collaborate in a multi-functional team.




So, here’s your opportunity! Join Analytics & Insights and help us anticipate what consumers want and find out what they need.




Qualifications




Translatable Rich Text




YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:




Studying towards MSc in a quantitative field, e.g. Engineering, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Physical Sciences or Quantitative Social Science;
Ability to handle multiple priorities and you have either an entrepreneur or consultancy mindset and passion for business while technically (data) savvy;
Work experience or certification in SQL, Python and/or R;
Strong analytical skills, using multiple data sources, with the ability to query and analyze data;
Creativity, Innovation, Initiative, Follow-Through, Strong written and verbal communication;
Experience from school/work that demonstrates strong leadership through envisioning, direction setting, enrolling others and thinking/problem solving.




YOUR ADVANTAGES:




27 paid vacation days
13 RTT (out of which 5 are collective ones)
3 bridge days offered by the company
Profit sharing
Company saving plan with company contribution
Health mutual and insurance
Company support for 50% on public transports costs in Paris area or eco mobility support (eg. bike)
Tickets Restaurant card by Edenred (optional)
Company restaurant
Work from Home (2 to 3 days/week, depending on the job)
Conciergerie services on site
Gym room on site for free
Work Council offers & subsidies
Xmas hamper
Coupons on our P&G products




ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:




Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.




Encouraging diversity in all its forms, P&G is committed to creating an inclusive work environment and promotes equal opportunities.

Company Description




Numberly is recognized as one of the world's leading data marketing specialists with nearly 500 employees and 8 offices worldwide serving more than 500 blue-chip clients (L'Oréal, P&G, Groupe Seb, HSBC...). By putting technology to work for brands and consumers, Numberly is at the heart of business growth and everyone's desire for more responsible and relevant marketing. Numberly leverages the latest advances in data processing, analysis, and media activation in a virtuous cycle of business competitiveness, enhanced privacy, and data protection.




Job Description




As a member of the Insights & Analytics team, you will perform consulting, modeling, and research on Numberly's client databases. The goal of this team is to improve customer knowledge in order to develop the best marketing strategies. You will be working with several types of big data: consumption, media reactions, navigation... You will work for all of our clients in various sectors: retail, banking, insurance, luxury, travel, food....




Examples of missions :




Analysis and understanding of the customer lifecycle and modeling of the customer Lifetime Value
Segmentation: buying behavior, browsing behavior
Behavior prediction scores: churn, lifetime moments, engagement
Analysis of the marketing levers and paths that maximize conversion
Modeling of declarative data via behavioral data




The methods used will be chosen according to the problem and in agreement with the trainee




Descriptive statistics
Typology of the database: ACM, ACP...
Segmentation of the database: CAH, neural networks...
Score : decision tree, logistic regression




5 to 6 months internship starting in June or July 2023.




Remuneration: 1300 € gross monthly in M1 (internship), 1600 € in M2 (internship).




Qualifications




You are a M1 or M2 graduate (engineering school, business school, university)
Knowledge in SQL, R, Python
Ability to fit in, autonomy and work capacity
Ability to question and problematize a study subject
Writing skills
Interest in marketing and the Internet
Sense of contact and strong motivation to work in an innovative environment (internet and mobile) within a young and international team




Additional Information




At Numberly, we share a passion for passing on information to both our teams and clients: weekly internal talks, meetings with professionals who are experts in their field, and ongoing learning.
Our onboarding is fast and powerful, thanks to the "Vis ma vie" (“Live my life” in different teams) and the "Happy Meetings" (monthly internal get-togethers with all of our teams around the world to share the group's latest news).
We cultivate freedom of speech, which allows everyone to participate in the group's on-going development.
We positively impact our ecosystem through 1000mercis actions and activities that create value in the Open Internet; we contribute to the enrichment of the Open Source.
Numberly is a diversity player and Gender Equal by design (WeConnect International certification and a gender equity score of 97/100).
Numberly offers an international environment, hosting over 30 nationalities worldwide.
Other perks: offices that reflect each team, a generous library, a large fully equipped music studio, two cats, waste separation and worm composting, the ability to bring your pet, and room for bikes! In each kitchen: coffee, tea, infusions at will and also mystery lunches, yoga classes, sports classes and parties (often disguised).
Possibility to be remote up to 50% of your time (to be organized as you wish) and to work up to 60 consecutive days (working days) in remote locations in Europe
Swile card (meal vouchers).
Numberly welcomes people with disabilities.

Job_title: Climate Data Analyst - Intern (Asset Impact) | Paris or Berlin
Job_description:
Asset Impact is an impact-driven climate start-up.

We are looking for an enthusiastic Climate Data Analyst Intern to join our team. If you’re someone who is passionate about sustainable finance, embraces a start-up mentality, and is excited to take on new challenges, we’d love to hear from you. We offer the opportunity to contribute to the world of ESG data, learn about data analysis applied to sectors key to the climate transition, and experience the growth phase of a start-up.

Responsibilities

Your primary responsibility will be to assist the Asset Impact Data Team, with frequent interactions with the Product and Business teams. You will make direct contributions to the development of our data and analytics. Depending on your profile and interests, you will:

Research commercial and open-source physical asset data providers and data sources to help improve the coverage and quality of Asset Impact’s climate data.
Conduct quality assurance (QA) and quality control (QC) checks of our data and climate indicators.
Support the onboarding of raw data into Asset Impact’s proprietary database.
Support the development of new products, metrics and methodologies in collaboration with the Asset Impact Product Team (e.g. financed emissions, scenario analysis).
Analyze corporate, climate and financial data and prepare responses to clients’ queries on Asset Impact’s data products.
Support the Data Team in any part of the Asset Impact data workflow.


Requirements

Experience summarizing technical information into concise texts for a general audience.
Knowledge of sustainability and sustainable finance.
Cleaning and analyzing data with code, and proficiency with R, or Python for data analysis and manipulation. Proficiency with SQL (or knowledge of relational databases) is a plus.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
Fluency in English.


Mindset

Passion for sustainability and data.
Interest in learning about climate-critical sectors such as power generation, oil and gas extraction, transport, etc.
Desire to work in an international start-up.
Enthusiasm and motivation!


Benefits

A paid internship lasting 4-6 months with a potential transition to a full-time role.
An opportunity to work with and learn from an international team of data scientists, analysts, sustainable finance specialists, and developers passionate about the climate transition.
Exposure to the latest tools and methodologies in tech and sustainability.
A rapidly growing organization with a lot of opportunities to get hands-on experience, make your voice heard and help shape our future.
A mission that brings together technology and impact.
Flexibility in terms of working hours and location.
Offices in the centers of Paris and Berlin.


Application process

We are recruiting for this position on a rolling basis. Please apply through the link below. We want motivated candidates – no need to tick all the skills and experience boxes! Phone interviews will be organized with shortlisted candidates.

We are looking for student interns (“stage de fin d’études”) in France in our Paris office or working students (“Werkstudierendenstatus”) in Germany in our Berlin office.

Asset Impact is proud to be an equal opportunity workspace.

Find out more at https://asset-impact.gresb.com/

About Us

Asset Impact (AI) is an impact-driven climate start-up. Our vision is of a financial system that sets the global economy on a path to net zero emissions. We are a specialist provider of climate data and analytics used by financial institutions to achieve emissions reductions in the real economy. Our asset-based data and analytics cover the most carbon-intensive sectors of the global economy and map more than 250,000 physical assets across nine industry sectors – linked to more than 60,000 listed and private companies – to issued securities.

Our clients, mostly financial institutions, include large global organizations such as the 1,000+ financial institutions applying the PACTA tool, Barclays for its BlueTrackTM tool, ING for its Terra climate approach, and PwC for its Climate Excellence Tool.

AI was established in 2018 in Paris, and works globally. We became part of GRESB, the leading ESG benchmark for real estate and infrastructure investments, in 2022 after spinning off from the 2° Investing Initiative, an innovative international think tank working to align financial markets with climate goals. We are expanding rapidly to support the growing needs of financial institutions as they embark on their journey to decarbonization.

Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 800 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are community, activism, transparency, dedication and greatness. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Data Scientist Apprentice (F/M/D)

12 months apprenticeship starting in September, based in Paris

About The Role

You will be responsible for assisting more senior Data Scientists in their research and development of models by exploring new features, model algorithms and analysing models performances. You should have strong knowledge of Machine Learning and Statistics, excellent data analytical skills with attention to details.

What You'll Do

Support the team with analysis and research to understand and recommend model improvements
Prototype new models and improve existing processes
Extract, transform and load data for machine learning models
Work closely with the rest of the Data Team (Data Engineers, BI Engineers)
Build model deployment pipelines


Who You Are

Currently enrolled in a Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering or related technical field
Experience using Pandas and SQL
Good knowledge of Python and standard machine learning libraries
Detail-oriented, self-starter, ability to timely execute and manage small projects
You can easily learn and adapt to a dynamic environment
You understand the importance of balancing doing R&D and regularly delivering value to the end-users
Problem solver with strong communication skills, a positive attitude, and empathy.
You can explain your technical choices in English. French is a plus.


What We Offer

A meaningful internship with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability
A flexible work possibility
The opportunity to do career defining work in a fast-growing French-born scale up
The possibility to work as part of a global diverse team with more than 50 nationalities
2 days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association
Significant investment in your learning and growth
Competitive compensation and benefits package


Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer

Data Analyst Marketing Apprentice (F/M/D)

12 months apprenticeship, starting in September, based in Paris

About The Role

You will be part of the global Performance marketing team and be responsible for reporting and monitoring the activity. As a Data Analyst intern, you will ensure that we have the right tools to steer and report. You'll be in charge of Affiliation data health! Using data analytics, you will support strategic decision making for business growth, working hand in hand with global functions, the regional teams and the data teams. You are entrepreneurial, a self-starter, comfortable both working independently as well as collaborating across teams. You are keen to dive headfirst into a fast-growing, global fashion tech business!

What You'll Do

Build and improve existing dashboard and reporting tools to help channel managers monitor their channel in the best way possible.
Automatize reporting & recurring reports.
Set up alerts to flag changes in reporting, highlighting data issues and changes in trends.
Set up new processes to automate data sends between numerous sources ensuring reporting is up to date and accurate.
Ensure all affiliate data is mapped correctly against each publisher and the wider channel to enable more accurate steering decisions.
Collaborate closely with the Marketing Intelligence team to support fixing open data issues.


Who You Are

Master's degree in Business, Data Science, Statistics, Digital Marketing.
Advanced proficiency in Excel and SQL.
Experience with a data visualization tool is a good plus (Tableau, Google Studio…).
Demonstrate an ability to understand performance and be able to identify opportunities.
Be structured, organized, motivated by a growing fast-paced team.
Enjoy working as a team-player and learning from others.
If you know how to code in python that's also a plus!
Fluent in English (French is not required).


What We Offer

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability
Hybrid working: working from the office 3-4 days per week
The opportunity to do career defining work in a fast growing French-born scale up
The possibility to work as part of a global diverse team with more than 50 nationalities
2 days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association
Significant investment in your learning and growth
Competitive compensation and benefits package
As a full member of our entrepreneurial project, you will be eligible to receive VC's shares.


Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer.

Environnement du poste

Afin de renforcer notre pôle Data, nous recrutons un Data Scientist. Travailler dans l’équipe Data chez Linxo, c’est avant tout développer des solutions data fiables et robustes. C’est également travailler en agilité au sein d’une squad composée de Data Engineers, de Data Analysts & Data Scientists, d’un PO et d’Ingénieurs QA pour avancer en toute autonomie.
Vous évoluerez dans un cadre dynamique et une équipe bienveillante et aurez rapidement des responsabilités pour délivrer sur des projets aussi essentiels qu’innovants.

Ce poste requiert des compétences techniques et des aptitudes à bien communiquer et prendre des initiatives afin de trouver des solutions.



 



Vos principales missions

Rattaché au Manager & TechLead du pôle Data, au sein d’une équipe agile, vous intégrez Linxo Group en tant que Data Scientist et vous serez amené entre autre à :



Contribuer au sein de l’équipe data à élargir la portée des services et produits de Linxo autour de la data (enrichissements multiples, analyse, business intelligence…)



Transformer de grand volumes de données en informations utiles et exploitables



Développer des modèles ML industrialisables servant entre autre à extraire des informations et enrichir des transactions bancaires



Créer un pipeline ML pour mise en production de modèles dans un environnement cloud



Assurer l’implémentation de projets Data depuis l’étude d’opportunité (POC, POV) jusqu’à la mise en production et son suivi en run



Travailler de manière collaborative et transverse avec les Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Data Analyst, PO, dev, SRE/OPs



Une liste non exhaustive de tâches, parce que chez Linxo Group, on ne s’ennuie pas




Stack technique



 



Python, JVM (Scala, Java)



Git



Cloud : AWS



Librairies : TensorFlow, Pytorch, NLTK, SpaCy, Flair



 



 



Rejoignez-nous si...

 



Vous avez 5 ans d’expérience professionnelle en conception, implémentation et maintenance de solutions innovantes utilisant la data science



Vous avez 3 ans d’expérience professionnelle en conception, implémentation et maintenance de produits NLP



Vous disposez d’une formation de type bac+5 pertinente en Statistique, Mathématiques, Informatique ou autre domaine équivalent



Vous connaissez les architectures micro services et avez une expérience en tant que MLOPs. Ainsi que des techniques et concepts de statistiques avancées (régression, propriété de distributions, tests statistiques) et une expérience de leur application



Vous maîtrisez une variété de techniques ML (clustering, décision tree learning, artificial neural networks), et leurs applications opérationnelles



Anglais et français courant



Bonnes qualités relationnelles et de communication, capacité à interagir avec les parties prenantes internes et externes, à travailler à la fois en autonomie et en équipe



Une capacité démontrée d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes




 



Notre process de recrutement
Un entretien de 45 min avec votre futur manager
Un entretien de 45 min avec une personne de l'équipe RH
Un entretien de 45 min avec votre future équipe
Une prise de référence systématique

> Si tout est ok, une promesse d’embauche vous sera présentée



 



 



Notre entreprise est engagée dans une politique en faveur de la diversité, de l’égalité professionnelle et de l’intégration et du maintien dans l’emploi des personnes en situation de handicap.

As a Data Analyst, you will have a key role in the implementation, consolidation, and verification of recurring resale analyses (diversion and second-hand) on a global scope.




Main Tasks:





Consolidation and monitoring of recurring resale analyses (Diversion and Second Hand) on a global scope.
Verification of the update of figures in the data visualization tool.
Updating and optimization of analyses for other internal services.
Study of second-hand trends in the luxury and fashion industry (competitive analyses).
Proposal for optimization of existing dashboards.
Supporting teams in discovering and using new dashboards.
Participation in the production of ad hoc analyses related to the House needs: launch of a new collection, focus on specific analyses, etc.
Supporting the deployment of Anti-Diversion technological projects.
Supporting teams in managing cross-functional projects and participation in the operational management of projects.
Working in a multidisciplinary team.
Listening and integration of Market/Region viewpoints in all projects.

Student in engineering school, Statistics/Commerce School, or equivalent, with an appetite for retail, luxury, and fashion issues.

Job_description:
Cette offre d’emploi est fournie par Pôle emploi




DescriptionAu sein du département réseau de la Direction Expérience client, vous êtes directement rattaché(e) au Responsable Administration Expérience Client et Outils. Vous intégrez une équipe de 5 personnes et avez pour rôle de : * Construire tous les reportings nécessaires au bon pilotage des indicateurs de la Direction * Assurer le suivi des Standards de Performance Qualité * Assurer les remontées de données via des outils automatisés Dans ce contexte, ils vous appartient de : * Garantir le pilotage régulier des Standards Performance Qualité auprès des CDR Performance Qualité et des concessionnaires : * Mettre en place des reporting permettant de suivre les principaux KPI et les automatiser dans un outil de Business Intelligence; * Participer à l'élaboration des Standards Performance Qualité en collaboration avec l'ensemble des équipes de la Direction; * Organiser le paiement des primes aux concessionnaires * Centraliser les KPI de la Direction Expérience Clients dans un outil de reporting visuel et automatisé, cela pour les différents Départements * Performance Qualité; * Développement Réseau; * Relation Clientèle; * Académie Toyota; * Plateau technique & Homologation * Être le contact privilégié de l'équipe terrain des Chefs de Région Performance Qualité; * Piloter le programme des enquêtes mystères : * Coordonner les différentes enquêtes avec les prestataires; * Fournir des reporting aux CDR Performance Qualité et aux concessionnaires; * Analyser les résultats et proposer des plans d'actions. * Assurer le suivi et animer les concours Expérience Client pour le Réseau de Concessionnaires (Club Brit, Ichiban) * Piloter l'administration du Portail Csmile (suppression des hot alertes, modification/création de compte pour le réseau) De formation supérieure (Bac +3 / +5) type Ecole de Commerce, vous avez une première expérience réussie d'au moins deux ans idéalement dans le secteur automobile. Ce qui nous plaira chez vous ? c'est vous-même ! Alors bien évidemment, on vous préfèrera : * Rigoureux(se) et analytique, vous êtes capable de concevoir et piloter des reportings pertinents * Organisé(e), vous savez définir des process et en assurer le suivi * Soucieux(se) du respect des délais, vous alliez réactivité, flexibilité et force de proposition * Votre anglais est opérationnel (oral et écrit) afin de vous accompagner dans la réussite de vos missions * Orienté(e) outil, vous savez élaborer des tableaux de bord, les commenter de façon synthétique et en assurer le suivi Nos emplois sont ouverts à tous. Avantages * Accords d'intéressement et de participation * Tarifs préférentiels sur les véhicules neufs * Programmes de « Lease Car » Quelles seront les étapes pour ce recrutement ? Etape 1 : Entretien visio avec la Responsable Carrière et Développement ainsi que le Manager Opérationnel direct Etape 2 : Entretien avec la DRH ainsi que le Directeur Opérationnel de la Direction pour laquelle vous postulez Etape 3 : il n'y en a pas ! optimisons le parcours candidat, nous sommes tous passés par là ! En amont de votre arrivée Nous aurons échangé ensemble afin d'identifier et anticiper un aménagement particulier de votre poste de travail, si nécessaire. Votre manager aura organisé un parcours d'intégration à travers différents RDV afin que vous puissiez rencontrer vos interlocuteurs privilégiés. Le jour de votre arrivée Vous êtes accueilli(e) par la Responsable Paie & Administration du Personnel afin de finaliser le volet administratif lié à votre embauche et vous présenter les politiques internes (IT, pointage présence, intranet.). Votre manager vient ensuite vous chercher. Vous irez ensemble au service informatique pour récupérer vos outils nécessaires, puis vous effectuerez une visite des locaux & des équipes. Vous déjeunez avec votre service. Quelques semaines après votre arrivée Vous serez convié(e) à une session d'intégration de 4 demi-journées. Les différents services de Toyota France vous présenteront leurs missions, enjeux, contexte. c'est l'occasion d'avoir une vue d'ensemble de l'entreprise Toyota monde, Europe & France

Job_title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer H/F
Job_description:
Description du poste Intitulé du poste




Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer H/F




Métier




Systèmes d'informations - Développement




Catégorie socio-professionnelle




Cadre




Présentation du contexte




Vous avez peut-être déjà voyagé avec nous, mais que connaissez-vous de notre stratégie de pricing sur les billets d’avions, ou encore de la complexité des opérations à réaliser pour permettre à un vol de partir à l’heure ?




Chaque année, Air France-KLM fait rêver 85 millions de passagers en les emmenant vers 250 destinations, grâce à une flotte de plus de 500 appareils. Le Groupe emploie 75 000 collaborateurs partout dans le monde : les opportunités sont vastes pour mettre à profit ses compétences, apprendre et se développer !




Avec une longévité de plus de 65 ans, le département de Recherche Opérationnelle d’Air France maintient sa position de leader dans le domaine de la Recherche Opérationnelle et de la Data Science, en créant des outils de prédiction et d’optimisation à disposition de l’ensemble des métiers de la compagnie : personnels navigants, maintenance aéronautique, programme de vols, centre de contrôle des opérations, pricing et revenue management etc. Pour ces métiers, le département développe des outils permettant notamment de :




Prédire le retard des vols
Prévoir le flux des passagers au sein du terminal
Optimiser le prix des billets d’avions
Déterminer les meilleurs plannings du personnel
Anticiper les pannes d’avions grâce à la maintenance prédictive
Optimiser le programme de vols




Description De La Mission




Notre mission ? Transformer la donnée brute en décision intelligente, pour mieux optimiser l'ensemble des métiers d’Air France – KLM !




Vous intégrerez une équipe aux profils variés constitués de data scientists et d’ingénieurs en optimisation, aux parcours académiques et aux compétences complémentaires. Ils travaillent main dans la main à l’élaboration des outils du futur. Vous évoluerez dans un environnement technique performant, et une équipe d’experts techniques sera là pour vous former et vous accompagner sur l’ensemble de vos projets.




Vos Missions




Participer à l’analyse des besoins métiers
Contribuer à la définition, au développement, à la mise en production et à la maintenance d’outils de machine learning
Présenter vos travaux auprès des utilisateurs
Organiser les retours d'expérience des solutions préconisées et mettre en œuvre l'amélioration continue des modèles utilisés




Profil recherché




Vos Compétences




Master ou Doctorat en Systèmes informatiques, Mathématiques appliquées, Recherche Opérationnelle, Data Science ou équivalent
Vous avez une bonne connaissance des techniques de machine learning
Vous maîtrisez Python
Vous êtes autonome, rigoureux(se), responsable et curieux(se), et aimez travailler en équipe
Vous possédez de bonnes capacités d'analyse, de synthèse et de communication
Vous parlez couramment Français et Anglais




Petit Plus




Vous avez de l’expérience avec les librairies scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Spark
Vous avez des notions de MLOps, CI/CD (Kubernetes, Docker, GCP, Airflow, REST API)




Et bien sûr, vous êtes passionné(e), ambitieux(se), et brillant(e) !




Ce Que Nous Vous Offrons




De la création de valeur pour l’ensemble des métiers d’Air France KLM
Des challenges et problématiques complexes à résoudre et l’opportunité de déployer du machine learning industriel dans un environnement Cloud !
Une grande part de responsabilité dans une structure hiérarchique horizontale
Un important degré de liberté pour apprendre et développer son expertise grâce aux formations internes de l’équipe Tech et Innovation.
Une équipe dynamique, animée par la motivation et la bienveillance
Télétravail possible (2 à 3 jours par semaine)
Des réductions sur les billets d’avions (à partir de 6 mois d’ancienneté)
Vous intégrerez le cursus NextGen, qui permet de découvrir les différents services et métiers de l’entreprise (visite du centre de contrôle, des pistes d’aéroport, échanges avec le personnel navigant…) et participer à des événements qui vous permettent de tisser des liens avec les autres jeunes salariés de l’entreprise et développer votre réseau.




On vous attend le plus rapidement possible ! Et pour une durée indéterminée ;)

CDI

Administratif

Bac + 5 et plus / 3ème année grande école




Niveau d'expérience min. requis
